entry.title: Markov Chain Monte Carlo(MCMC)
entry.content:
Introduction

Once I heard this method is in a book about finance which is called Fooled by Randomness: The Hidden Role of Chance in Life and in the Markets. The author use the method A Monte Carlo generator to generate a large number of random events an track their evolution by predifined model rules to approximate real physical processes. There is a little difference between MCMC and monte carlo generator. I will introduce monte carlo at first and then introduce markov chain with their implementations. And finally introduce monte carlo generate in another article.

Monte Carlo

Monte Carlo method is alse called statistical simulation method, which uses random sampling and staistical modeling to solve complex problems with uncertainty and multiple variables.

The key characteristics of monte carlo methods are random sampling, approximation, law of large number and flexibility.

The work procedure of monte carlo methods below:

  1. Define the problem
  2. Generate random inputs
  3. Evaluate outputs
  4. Analyze results

Random Sampling

classical random sampling method:

  • simple random sampling(SRS) : Each element in the population has an equal chance of being selected. samples are i.i.d. .

  • stratified sampling : The population is divided into distinct subgroups (strata) that are each homogeneous in some characteristic.(based on this characteristic)

  • systematic sampling : A systematic approach to random sampling where you select every k -th element from a population list, starting from a randomly chosen point.(based solely on position/order within the population)

  • importance sampling : A Monte Carlo method where samples are drawn from a distribution that emphasizes (or “weights”) more important regions of the space, and then adjustments (weights) are applied to the results to reflect the true distribution.

    • How to work : Instead of sampling directly from the target distribution, you sample from an easier, auxiliary distribution, and weight the samples to correct for the difference between the two distributions.

  • Acceptance-Rejection sampling : A method to generate random samples from a complex target distribution by sampling from a simpler proposal distribution and rejecting samples that don’t meet a certain condition.

    • How to work : You sample from a proposal distribution and accept the sample only if a randomly generated number satisfies a certain acceptance criterion. This allows you to approximate the target distribution even if it’s not easy to sample from directly.

entry.title: How to learn Statistical Machine Learning1
Learn DataBase
entry.content:
How to learn database

ER Model

Firstly, you should learn ER model, which contains entity set and entity, different entity in an entity set is distinguished by their attributes. Among their attributes, there are super key, candidate key, primary key and foreign key. Primary key is important which can determine entity uniquely, foreign key is referenced to key in other table.

It involves key constraints and total participation which is important.

Besides, there are some special models which involves ISA, weak entity, tenary relationship and aggregation.

Relational Model

After you learn ER model, you should know how to change it into relational model which is included by schema and instance, also cardinality(rows) and fields. Meanwhile, you will learn use SQL to create table (their synatx and data types)and put constraints in it. Operations like adding, deleting and inserting is important. And with foreign key it involves a question about (On *** CASCADE / SET DEFAULT)

You should pay attention special relations like ISA, weak entity. (how to show key constraint is important with primary key, unique, not null)

View is also a knowledge point but it’s simple.

SQL

Firstly, you should know the simple structure of “SELET,,,FROM,,,,WHERE,,,”. When learning this part, JOIN and LEFT JOIN is interesting. For maching String, we will use LIKE”aA_%” which is important.

Set operation UNION, INTERSECT, EXCEPT is essential. Division is tricky to implement with NOT EXISTS and EXCEPT. There are also key words ALL, ANY.
